title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: The children nodes are not listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: Expected behavior is that when changing the data source, the children nodes of the new data source should be listed.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Select a new data source that has no database/table/column information. 
3. Observe that no children nodes are listed when changing the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. 
4. Close the data set editor and reopen it. 
5. Observe that the children nodes of the new data source are still not listed.
